column1: Care Activities
Receive patient admission report
Complete intake process (confirm non-clinical/demographic information)
Coordinate referrals to complete discipline specific intake/consent.
Confirm if MOST exists, flag if not
Prepare for patient admission - (room cleaning)
Prepare for patient admission - room set up (basic supplies)
Prepare for patient admission (patient specific needs - equipment)
Prepare for patient admission (patient specific needs - psychosocial/spiritual, translation services, cultural safety)
Orientate patient and family to unit and hospital
Screen for patient ability to perform ADLs.
Assess for patient ability to complete ADLs.
Assist with patient personal care tasks to support activities of daily living
Perform patient personal care tasks to support activities of daily living
Encourage patient to complete personal care tasks to support activities of daily living
Trim nails on hands/feet (no chronic conditions)
Trim nails on hands/feet (chronic conditions)
Apply therapeutic hot applications (as directed in care plan).
Apply therapeutic cold applications (as directed in care plan).
Insert hearing aid
Screen for patient ability to perform instrumental activities of daily living (iADsL)
Assess for patient ability to perform instrumental activities of daily living (IADL)
Refer to community resources for support for ADLs/iADLs
Screen for mobility ambulation
Screen for mobility transfers
Assess patient positioning including turns
Assist with patient positioning
Assess patient transfers
Assist with patient transfer (with mechanical aids (e.g. slings, lifts)
Assist with patient transfer (without mechanical aids)
Transfer patient (with mechanical aids)
Transfer patient (without mechanical aids)
Position patient in bed
Assist with patient positioning in bed
Monitor physical restraints (i.e., soft, hard, lock)
Assess need for patient physical restraints - LC
Assist registered health professional with application of physical restraints (i.e., soft, hard, lock)
Screen patient for risk factors for falls and fall-related injuries
Assess patient for risk factors for falls and fall-related injuries
Observe and report risk of falls
Conduct spasticity assessment
Screens patient mobility (e.g. pre-handling checklist)
Assess patient functional mobility and determine level of complexity
Assess patient for ongoing functional and therapeutic mobilization
Assess patient mobility (complex) for the purpose of monitoring a patient's progress as documented in care plan
Develop mobility/musculoskeletal care plan based on assessment
Assists with mobility/functional, range of motion and strength exercises
Assess patient need for mobility aids
Prescribe mobility aids (medical device) based on assessment
Assist with assessment of patient need for mobility aids
Take an x-ray image of the indicated body part of the patient at their bed location using a portable x-ray machine
Perform venipuncture
Remove staples and sutures
Administers prescription drugs (schedule 1 drugs) by any method
Administer controlled drugs and substances (schedule 1A drugs) by any method)
Obtain Best Possible Medication History
Compound prescription drugs (schedule 1 drugs)
Compound controlled drugs and substance (schedule 1A drugs)
Dispense controlled drugs and substance (schedule 1A drugs)
Dispense prescription drugs (schedule 1 drugs)
Prescribe controlled drugs and substance (schedule 1A drugs)
Prescribe prescription drugs (schedule 1 drugs)
